channel.title: Animation/GFX Glitch
channel.description:
When I do an emote such as a skillcape emote or a special attack, the GFX is messed up and shows a part of the GFX (flash) for a short moment. I'm not sure where the problem is coming from, but I'm thinking it has something to do with the animations.
If you don't know what I'm talking about, heres a video: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OmtbKD74mhk[/youtube]
(Good example is when I do the AGS spec)
:)

item.title: Animation/GFX Glitch
item.dc:creator: @xEvo Exion
item.description:
@xEvo wrote:

sinisoul:

Might have something to do with you client loop and an synchronization of the animation frames? Possibly. It doesn’t look like your t-groups and v-groups are messed up so I am putting my bet on that.

Alright, I’ll take a look. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Animation/GFX Glitch
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Exion, post:1, topic:418715”]When I do an emote such as a skillcape emote or a special attack, the GFX is messed up and shows a part of the GFX (flash) for a short moment. I’m not sure where the problem is coming from, but I’m thinking it has something to do with the animations.

If you don’t know what I’m talking about, heres a video:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OmtbKD74mhk[/youtube]

(Good example is when I do the AGS spec)

:)[/quote]

Might have something to do with you client loop and an unsynchronization of the animation frames? Possibly. It doesn’t look like your t-groups and v-groups are messed up so I am putting my bet on that.

Read full topic
